data.title: Memorable... in a good way!
data.text: I was fortunate enough to dine at Morton's, Nashville, with long-term friends from Dallas, whilst I was visiting Nashville from the UK. What a great night. The restaurant is pretty upmarket, as are the prices, though the food (shrimp and steak and presentation was spectacularly good. Really. Nice vibe and pretty busy when we visited, which felt good. The service was a little stiff to start with, though some chat and a little humour soon brought the waiters to life who became part of our evening with good spirit, wit and great service. The wine was perfect for the meal, too. Perfect for a special treat with friends or a family occasion. Value for money? Memories and special nights with great friends/family don't really have a price... dig deep and spoil yourself!

data.title: Best steakhouse yet!
data.text: This was my first time visiting Morton's and it was by far the best steakhouse I have ever eaten at.  The service was outstanding, the food was amazing and the place was very swanky.  The carrot cake was huge!  The entire experience blows all other steakhouses out of the way!  I will remember this meal for a very long time.  If I'm ever back in Nashville, I will make sure to stop here again.  Thank you so much for this amazing experience.

data.title: Very pricey, but worth the adventure into elegance..
data.text: Our budget does not ordinarily allow dining at high end restaurants such Morton's, Ruth's Chris, and the like.  Therefore, we only do so to celebrate an important family event.  October 30 was my 79th birthday, so my wife and daughters treated me to a memorable dinner at this 5 star restaurant, much to my surprise.  Elegant in every respect, this steak house has few peers.  Everything from the decor, service, ambiance, and, obviously, the food was unbeatable.  Located in the downtown area of Nashville, TN, valet service is available, as well as plenty of other parking options.  Yes, it's pricey, something we knew that going in. But the lasting memories we thus created, are priceless.

data.title: A quiet dinner in a very busy town
data.text: My friend and I dined at Morton's on a crazy Nashville Saturday night. I was surprised to see that it wasn't packed, but I guess everyone was at the Adele concert ;) Upon arriving we sat at the bar. The bar was not well maintained and I was a bit shocked (dirty glasses all over the place and yet it was pretty empty). We ordered our drinks and the "bartender" questioned what we wanted...kind of odd (we ordered gin & tonic and she asked if we wanted martinis?). Another bartender swooped in and he was great. We sat down to eat and our waiter adopted a strange accent and told us about the specials in a quirky unprofessional way "The Wagyu beef is massaged by me personally every day", etc. Too much. It's Morton's not TGIFridays. I didn't like that. Considering that the place was almost empty, I was surprised by how long our steaks took. Our waiter kept coming back to our table to provide another joke and we deadpanned that maybe we should have ordered a pizza. "And how do you like your pizza madam?" was the response..."with double anchovies" I dryly answered - because by this time the carrying on was ridiculous. Our steaks came and were delicious and the sides were huge and very good. And you know that waiter brought me a huge side of anchovies? Pretty sassy. Anyway, the food was consistent and I have no complaints. There's a lot of good food to be had in Nashville and I may go back to Morton's if I am craving a good quiet steak but watch out for the sideshow act...

data.title: Quiet location, friendly staff
data.text: I had an off menu veggie plate.   The portions were huge and I was able to have 3 meals from the one order.   The veggies were well cooked, fresh, and perfectly seasoned.

data.title: Stylish place
data.text: We only visited the bar, friendly staff and excellent appetisers which are half price in the early evening 'happy hour' and after 9pm.

data.title: Consistent
data.text: We went here to celebrate my brother's engagement. As usual, the food was good. Service was fine but I feel like sometimes we get these odd waiters. I felt like our waiter had a fake accent or he was using it as a performance. Food is consistently good. Always good for a group celebration.

data.title: Excellent food & Service
data.text: Have eaten at Morton's at least 8-10 times over the last several years, usually with big groups.  The steaks are reliably prepared and worthy of the price. The lobster mac and cheese is great side-dish, be sure to order the house specialty .  chocolate cake.  Only one time was the service shaky but it was  a very large group..  Also located in walking distance to anywhere downtown.

data.title: Awesome Bar Bites!!!
data.text: we went to the bar (bar 1221) for bar bites and cocktails after work.  the most adorable and friendly bartender was our server!  we had wine, water and tea...and ordered tuna tacos, crab sandwiches, filet mignon sandwiches and short rib tacos.  each plate was simply delicious!  for the price, the portions were amazingly generous.

data.title: loud but great food
data.text: white tablecloth with great service! cuts of meat wheeled around for education. good place for special occasion, but not too mushy because its loud and bright.

data.title: Stop the taxi
data.text: I had to stop the taxi when I saw the Morton s restaurant.  It did not disappoint.  Food was great with very good service.

data.title: They stole 30 dollars from our visa
data.text: Dispite good food and service, we somehow got charged 30 dollars more than the patuited ammount (tips included) on our visa. This made the dinner even more expensive than it already was (very expensive).

data.title: Excellent servce
data.text: We had a party of 7 celebrating my mother in laws 80th birthday. The attention to detail was top notch, from the personalized menu to a souvenir photo and birthday dessert presentation. Our server, Christy, was as good as you could ask for. She was very patient with the elderly ones at the table as well as attentive to food allergies. The food was excellent. The only down side was the noise level. Nothing out of the ordinary for a busy steakhouse, just difficult to hear all at the large table.

data.title: Somewhat, Disappointed
data.text:
I enjoy going to Mortons in whatever city I am in when travlling around the states.  I go for the great food and wine, matched with its great service.  Tonight we missed the happy hour by minutes but alas it was not the happy hour prices that tempted us to go this evening; happy hour is a good deal.  

Unfortunately Morton's did not match what I expect from them; we waited almost 30 minutes for our starter - oysters.  They recognised the problem and did not charge us for them which was very kind of them to do that, so thanks.  You know I would have preferred not to wait and paid.  Thanks again for putting it right.  I did enjoy the rest of my meal

data.title: Must-go for Date Night!
data.text: When you book a reservation, they cater to your special event. I went for my boyfriends birthday and they took a picture of us, and gave it back personalized as a birthday gift, they personalized the menu for him as well as gave us dessert on the house. It was lovely! The restaurant has a very romantic, modern ambiance and the food is out of this world DELICIOUS! I had the Filet Minon and to say that it was soft is an understatement, it melted in my mouth. Amazing dining experience! A bit pricey but SO WORTH IT if you want to enjoy a satisfying food, service and romantic night with your other half. ♥

data.title: Great Place for Special Occasion
data.text: We were there recently for our Anniversary, We love Morton's. The steaks are especially good, we always get the jumbo shrimp cocktail. the sauce is delicious. The chopped spinach salad is top of the line YUMMY. My husband had the hash browns and I had my favorite lyonnaise potatoes. Molten chocolate cake and we brought home a piece of key lime pie, we had plenty of leftovers for a very nice lunch the next day. I have no problem taking home a doggie bag for humans. It can be pricey and all portions can easily be shared to help it not be so expensive. We have been going there for decades so it is a go to place for us. The staff are always welcoming. We always valet our car.

data.title: Best Steak in Town
data.text: This place never disappoints. Excellent service, wonderful food. Top notch experience. I highly recommend the Cajun ribeye.

data.title: What happened to the great food
data.text: We had such bad food every where on this trip we want to go somewhere we knew would be good. Man did they miss the mark. My wife had had the recommend fish dish n it was over cooked n smothered in butter. I had the veal chop ordered rare n it was tough n over cooked. The salads were good but the main course we're not on park with the Mortons in Texas.

data.title: Dinner with friends
data.text: Cassie did a great job. Very attentive. Filet was so tender and delicious. The crab cakes were awesome. We had a wonderful experience.

data.title: fantastic dinner!
data.text: Everyone from the hostess to the bartender to the server was very helpful. Service was on point, very attentive, but not overbearing. Our steaks were cooked perfectly and the sides were delicious. Our server could not have been more helpful with cocktail and wine selections.
